org.apache.hadoop.hive.llap.cache

Class LlapAllocatorBuffer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hadoop.hive.llap.cache.LlapCacheableBuffer
      • org.apache.hadoop.hive.llap.cache.LlapAllocatorBuffer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.apache.hadoop.hive.common.io.encoded.MemoryBuffer
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    LlapDataBuffer, MetadataCache.LlapMetadataBuffer, SerDeLowLevelCacheImpl.LlapSerDeDataBuffer

    public abstract class LlapAllocatorBuffer
extends LlapCacheableBuffer
implements org.apache.hadoop.hive.common.io.encoded.MemoryBuffer
    We want to have cacheable and non-allocator buffers, as well as allocator buffers with no cache dependency, and also ones that are both. Alas, we could only achieve this if we were using a real programming language.

        public int decRef()

      • invalidate

        public int invalidate()
        Invalidates the cached buffer. The memory allocation in memory manager is managed by the caller, and therefore we mark the buffer as having released the memory too.
        Specified by:
        invalidate in class LlapCacheableBuffer
        Returns:
        Whether the we can invalidate; false if locked or already evicted.

      • invalidateAndRelease

        public int invalidateAndRelease()
        Invalidates the uncached buffer. The memory allocation in memory manager is managed by the allocator; we will only mark it as released if there are no concurrent moves. In that case, the caller of this will release the memory; otherwise, the end of move will release.
        Returns:
        Arena index, if the buffer memory can be released; -1 otherwise.

      • releaseInvalidated

        public int releaseInvalidated()
        Marks previously invalidated buffer as released.
        Returns:
        Whether the buffer memory can be released.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class LlapCacheableBuffer

      • toDebugString

        public String toDebugString()

        public boolean startMoveOrDiscard(int arenaIx,
                                  int headerIx,
                                  boolean isForceDiscard)

      • cancelDiscard

        public Boolean cancelDiscard()
        Returns:
        null if no action is required; otherwise, the buffer should be deallocated and, if the value is true, its memory should be released to the memory manager.

      • endDiscard

        public Boolean endDiscard()
        Returns:
        null if no action is required; otherwise, the buffer should be deallocated and, if the value is true, its memory should be released to the memory manager.
